intro: Eragrostis barbiglumis, commonly known as the hairy beardgrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, awned florets. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eragrostis barbiglumis is typically found in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
